medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual health until approximately 10 days before admission, when episodes of increasing dyspnea on exertion developed. Approximately 1 hour before presentation, substernal chest pain developed during sexual intercourse, associated with dyspnea, nausea, and diaphoresis. The chest pain rated 7 to 8 on a scale of 0 to 10 and resolved spontaneously shortly after arrival at the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV infection and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) diagnosed 18 years earlier, with a history of bacterial pneumonia, thrush, malassezia folliculitis, molluscum contagiosum, herpes zoster, oral hairy leukoplakia, chronic lymphocytic meningitis, pseudotumor cerebri, osteoporosis, cervical dysplasia, peripheral neuropathy, lipodystrophy, and dyslipidemia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had hypertension, arthritis, a myocardial infarction, and a stroke. Father and brother had myocardial infarctions in their 50s; father, brother, and sister had hyperlipidemia; uncle and cousin had colon cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Occasional alcohol consumption, stopped smoking 4 years earlier, and discontinued illicit injection drug use more than 15 years earlier. Works in the service industry.
